Kalashnikov factory in Armenia will produce up to 50,000 AK-103 rifles annually - FSMTC

MOSCOW. June 4 (Interfax) - An Armenian factory will begin assembling Kalashnikov AK-103 assault rifles in July under a license issued for 10 years, spokesperson for Russia's Federal Service for Military-Technical Cooperation (FSMTC) Maria Vorobyova told Interfax on Thursday.

"Production capacity will be up to 50,000 items annually. The validity period of the license is 10 years," Vorobyova said.

Russia and Armenia earlier signed a contract on the delivery of components as part of organizing the step-by-step assembly of AK-103 assault rifles in Armenia in implementation of the relevant FSMTC resolution dated May 15, 2020.

It is planned that the Armenian factory will start producing AK-103 rifles in the first ten days of July 2020.

Chemical Disarmament and Military Ecology

Russia to test Covid-19 vaccine on 50 volunteers from military personnel - Russian Defense Ministry

MOSCOW. June 2 (Interfax) - Russia is launching clinical trials of a Covid-19 vaccine on volunteers among Russian Armed Forces personnel, the Russian Defense Ministry said on Tuesday.

"The Defense Ministry of Russia has finished selecting volunteers for clinical trials of a one-of-a-kind domestically developed vaccine for the novel coronavirus infection Covid-19. Fifty military personnel, among them five women, who volunteered to take part in trials of the new vaccine, have been selected for tests of the vaccine's safety and effectiveness," the ministry said in a press release shared with Interfax.

The Covid-19 vaccine in question was developed with the help of the Russian military, namely the Russian Defense Ministry's 48th Central Scientific Research Institute, which will host the clinical trials.

"The first group of volunteer servicemen is expected to arrive at a specialized medical center at the 48th Central Scientific Research Institute of the Russian Defense Ministry on June 3 to undergo a preliminary in-depth health checkup and prepare for the experiment," the ministry said.

All candidates already underwent a preliminary health checkup and testing and have not been diagnosed with any diseases for a month, it said.

The participants in the clinical trials were selected from different Armed Forces units from all over the country, it said.

The clinical trials of the vaccine will be carried out on the premises of the 48th Central Scientific Research Institute, which previously hosted successful trials of vaccines for Ebola, Middle East Respiratory Syndrome, and a universal flu vaccine, the military said.

Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu told President Vladimir Putin on May 26 that clinical trials of the coronavirus vaccine will be completed before the end of July.

The vaccine is being developed by the 48th Central Scientific Research Institute of the Radiation, Chemical, and Biological Protection Troops of the Defense Ministry together with the Nikolai Gamaleya National Epidemiology and Microbiology Research Center of the Health Ministry. The 48th Central Scientific Research Institute specializes in developing medical protection against particularly dangerous diseases for the Armed Forces and the civilian population.

Coronavirus outbreaks averted in Russian military units - Shoigu

MOSCOW. June 2 (Interfax) - Outbreaks of coronavirus have been averted in Russian military units, and most of the 6,500 coronavirus patients in the military have now recovered, Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu said at a teleconference on Tuesday.

"The timely implementation of a package of anti-epidemic measures and systemic round-the-clock control over these measures by the operative headquarters enabled us to avert Covid-19 outbreaks in military units," Shoigu said.

"A total of 6,500 persons associated with the Armed Forces have contracted the infection since early March, and over 4,300 of them have already been discharged from hospitals," he said.

The number of recoveries daily has been exceeding the number of current patients since May 9, Shoigu said.

Additionally, all troops are regularly tested for coronavirus, Shoigu said.

Russian Armed Forces record over 4,000 recoveries from Covid-19 among personnel

MOSCOW. June 3 (Interfax) - The Russian Armed Forces have registered more than 4,000 recoveries from coronavirus within the system, the Defense Ministry said on Tuesday.

"The total number of recoveries in the Russian Armed Forces has increased to 3,881," the ministry stated on its website.

Among civilian personnel, the figure is 340, it said.

The current number of infections is 1,444 among servicemen in military commands, units and formations, 436 cadets and students of military academies, and 360 civilian specialists, the ministry said.

Covid-19 vaccine developed jointly with Russian military ready for clinical trials

MOSCOW. June 5 (Interfax) - Preparations have been completed for the start of clinical trials of a Covid-19 vaccine, which has been developed by the Russian military together with the Nikolai Gamaleya National Epidemiology and Microbiology Research Center, employee of a branch of the Burdenko Main Military Hospital Natalya Pozdnyakova said.

Fifty volunteers have been selected among Russian Armed Forces personnel for participation in the clinical trials, while the vaccine itself have already undergone tests for toxicity, safety, immunogenicity, and protective efficiency on large and small animals (monkeys and hamsters) at the 48th Central Scientific Research Institute of the Russian Defense Ministry, she said.

"In such a way, the Defense Ministry together with the Nikolai Gamaleya National Epidemiology and Microbiology Research Center has completed preparations for the start of clinical trials of this unique domestic vaccine for the Covid-19 coronavirus infection," the Defense Ministry's Krasnaya Zvezda newspaper quoted Pozdnyakova as saying.

During the selection of candidates, each volunteer was required to undergo a full range of medical examinations, she said.

A separate, isolated hospital building was allocated for the selected volunteers, who include 45 men and five women. Prior to that, the building was fully disinfected and all of its premises were sanitized. The volunteers were transported to the site of the experiment by previously disinfected vehicles.

"All of them are serving under contract. They are warrant officers and officers aged between 25 and 50 years old, since legislation of the Russian Federation prohibits conducting trials on conscripts," Pozdnyakova said.

These 50 volunteers include ten healthcare workers, including three doctors.

Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu told President Vladimir Putin during a videoconference on May 26 that the 48th Central Scientific Research Institute of the Radiation, Chemical, and Biological Protection Troops of the Defense Ministry together with the Nikolai Gamaleya National Epidemiology and Microbiology Research Center are developing a recombinant vaccine for the novel coronavirus. Clinical trials of the vaccine are expected to be completed before the end of July.

Turkey's orders for Russian military hardware estimated at approx. $1 bln - FSMTC head

MOSCOW. June 2 (Interfax) - Turkey's book of orders for Russian military hardware stands at approximately $1 billion, Director of Russia's Federal Service for Military-Technical Cooperation (FSMTC) Dmitry Shugayev said.

"The book of orders with Turkey for Russian hardware is estimated at around $1 billion," Shugayev told the Ekoturk television channel.

The latest products of the aircraft industry and more were demonstrated to Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan at the Russian MAKS air show, he said.

"It's not a secret that our partners were greatly impressed by our aircraft. Besides, dialogue on a number of other avenues of military-technical cooperation, including future ones, has taken shape," Shugayev said.

Russia prepared to consider Turkey's involvement in manufacturing S-400 systems - FSMTC head

MOSCOW. June 2 (Interfax) - Russia stands ready to discuss the involvement of Turkish companies in the manufacture of S-400 Triumph air defense systems, Director of the Russian Federal Service for Military-Technical Cooperation (FSMTC) Dmitry Shugayev said.

"We are prepared to explore opportunities for technological cooperation. That is, the involvement of Turkish companies in the manufacturing process," Shugayev said in an interview shown on the Ekoturk television channel.

Such negotiations are currently ongoing, but "this is a painstaking process requiring a certain amount of time," he said.

Russia ready to supply Su-35 jets to Turkey, joint production of aircraft, air defense systems being discussed - FSMTC head

MOSCOW. June 2 (Interfax) - Russian and Turkish specialists are discussing joint projects in the fields of aviation and air defense, Director of the Russian Federal Service for Military-Technical Cooperation (FSMTC) Dmitry Shugayev said.

"At the moment, our specialists are discussing possible options for cooperation in the joint production of aircraft and air defense systems. I have no doubt that the potential for our interaction is not limited to this," Shugayev said on the Ekoturk television channel on Tuesday.

As for the possible delivery of Sukhoi Su-35 fighters to Turkey, Shugayev said, "If Turkey chooses to buy such aircraft, we'll be ready to hold the relevant consultations with our colleagues."

Arms Trade

Russia working on export version of Armata tank - source

MOSCOW. June 5 (Interfax) - Russia has begun working on the export version of its Armata tank, an informed source told Interfax.

"Work to prepare the product for export is in progress: specialists are deciding which [elements] could be included in the export version and which elements will be installed only on tanks intended for the [Russian] military," the source said.

However, Armata exports should not be expected to start until all supply obligations to the Russian Defense Ministry are fulfilled, the source said.

"T-90 tanks in different modifications are being exported presently. This is where focus will be placed for now," he said.

Meanwhile, another source told Interfax that the Armata has already received its export certificate.

Interfax does not have official confirmation of the report.

Russia has received preliminary applications for Armata tanks from foreign customers, Russian Industry and Trade Minister Denis Manturov said in April.

Manturov also said that the T-14 Armata had been tested in Syria. The Russian Defense Ministry, for its part, did not report any Armata trials in Syria.

According to earlier reports, Uralvagonzavod developed the Armata heavy tracked vehicle platform. The T-14 tank, the T-15 infantry fighting vehicle, and the T-16 armored repair and evacuation vehicle are based on the platform. Armata-based vehicles are now undergoing trials.

The T-14 is the world's only tank of the third post-war generation. Military experts see it as a cutting-edge, one-of-a-kind tank. The Armata tank is a completely new and fully Russian development. Equipped with an unmanned turret, it is the first tank where the crew is placed in an armored capsule separated from the ammunition load.

Some elements of 1945 Victory Parade to be reconstructed during June 24, 2020 parade - Russian Ground Forces commander

MOSCOW. June 2 (Interfax) - The Victory Parade on Red Square in Moscow on June 24, 2020 will begin at 10:00 a.m. Moscow Time, will last for up to an hour and a half, and will include some elements of the historic parade of June 24, 1945, Russian Ground Forces Commander Col. Gen. Oleg Salyukov said at a teleconference on Tuesday.

"The start of the Victory Parade is set for 10:00 a.m. on June 24," Salyukov said.

"The overall duration of the parade will be up to an hour and a half," Salyukov said.

The parade scenario and the sequence in which the military columns are to pass will remain the same, he said.

The number of ceremonial details of the Russian Armed Forces for the June 24 parade has been updated, and the organizers are finalizing the determination of foreign military units to take part in the parade, he said.

"During the ceremonial events, some elements of the historic parade of June 24, 1945 are to be used. For example, the Jubilee Slow March will be played at the beginning of the parade, and an identical firework show is planned for the evening," he said.
